title: Kutukan Raja Pulau Mintin
description: In ancient times, on an island called Mintin, reigned a just and wise king. However, a curse befell the king, transforming him into a giant snake after he violated a prohibition.

title: Tari Kayau
description: Tari Kayau is a Dayak war dance that depicts the bravery and strength of warriors in defending their territory. Its dynamic and energetic movements are accompanied by traditional music that evokes spirit.

title: Tari Saman
description: Tari Saman is a Gayo tribal dance that showcases the synchronized hand movements and chest thumps of the dancers. This dance is usually performed without musical accompaniment, relying solely on the dancers' voices.

title: Rumah Adat Krong Bade
description: Rumah Krong Bade, or Rumoh Aceh, is a traditional stilt house with distinctive Acehnese carvings symbolizing the owner's social status. This house is designed to withstand earthquakes and floods.

title: Lompat Batu Nias
description: Fahombo or Stone Jumping is a coming-of-age ritual for young men in Nias. They must jump over a stack of stones more than two meters high to prove their maturity and courage.

title: Tari Tor Tor
description: Tari Tor Tor is a traditional Batak dance used in various traditional ceremonies, such as weddings and guest welcoming. Its slow and solemn movements carry deep philosophical meanings.

title: Cerita Rakyat Malin Kundang
description: The story of Malin Kundang tells of a disobedient son who was cursed into stone by his mother. This legend is very famous and serves as a lesson about the importance of respecting parents.

title: Rumah Gadang
description: Rumah Gadang is a Minangkabau traditional house with characteristic 'gonjong' roofs resembling buffalo horns. This house is a symbol of matriarchy in Minangkabau culture.

title: Tari Zapin
description: Tari Zapin is a Malay dance influenced by Arab culture. This dance is usually performed in pairs with agile movements and accompanied by gambus music.

title: Upacara Balimau Kasai
description: Balimau Kasai is a self-purification ceremony performed by the Kampar community to welcome the holy month of Ramadan. This tradition involves bathing with water mixed with lime and fragrances.

title: Tari Sekapur Sirih
description: Tari Sekapur Sirih is a welcoming dance for esteemed guests from Jambi. The dancers carry a 'cerana' filled with betel leaves as a symbol of respect and hospitality.

title: Rumah Adat Kajang Lako
description: Rumah Kajang Lako is a typical Jambi stilt house with a curved roof shaped like a boat. This house is built with natural materials from the forest.

title: Aesan Gede
description: Aesan Gede is a traditional bridal attire from Palembang that symbolizes the grandeur and luxury of the Srivijaya Kingdom. This attire is dominated by gold and red colors.

title: Tari Tanggai
description: Tari Tanggai is a welcoming dance performed by female dancers wearing 'tanggai' or long, slender fake nails. This dance symbolizes grace and hospitality.

title: Tari Campak
description: Tari Campak is a cheerful social dance from Bangka Belitung. This dance is usually performed during harvest festivals as an expression of gratitude and joy.

title: Rumah Rakit Limas
description: Rumah Rakit Limas is a traditional house built on rafts along the river. This house is an adaptation of the community to the geographical conditions of the aquatic areas.

title: Tari Andun
description: Tari Andun is a folk dance performed in pairs by young men and women at wedding parties. This dance serves as a means to find a spouse.

title: Upacara Tabot
description: The Tabot Ceremony is an annual ritual to commemorate the passing of Prophet Muhammad's grandson, Hussein bin Ali. This ceremony features a procession of decorated wooden chests or 'tabot'.

title: Tari Jangget
description: Tari Jangget is a grand dance from Lampung. This dance is usually performed at traditional ceremonies and festivities to welcome important guests.

title: Rumah Adat Nuwo Sesat
description: Nowo Sesat is a large stilt house that serves as a traditional meeting hall for community leaders or 'penyimbang' in Lampung society.

title: Tari Sirih Kuning
description: Tari Sirih Kuning is a welcoming dance gracefully performed by female dancers. Its movements symbolize respect and the offering of betel leaves as a sign of friendship.
